evidence.name: Bloodstained Tekiro Wrench
evidence.description: A 12-inch Tekiro adjustable wrench with blue handle, discovered hidden in Depot A maintenance area. Shows clear bloodstains on the metal head and partial fingerprints on the handle.
evidence.location: Depot A - Morning Shift Area (hidden behind equipment locker)
evidence.analysisResults: Blood type matches victim. Fingerprints partially smudged but show traces consistent with work gloves. Tool serial number matches maintenance department inventory.

evidence.name: Torn Luggage Tag with Cipher
evidence.description: Fragments of a luggage tag (LUG-457) found near the crime scene, containing a Caesar cipher message. When reconstructed, reveals coded meeting arrangement.
evidence.analysisResults: Caesar cipher with shift of 7. Decoded message: 'MEET AT STORE ROOM'. Handwriting analysis pending.

evidence.name: CCTV Footage - Platform 2
evidence.description: Security camera footage from Platform 2 showing victim's final movements at 19:45-19:55. Shows Pak Budi appearing agitated and checking his watch repeatedly.
evidence.analysisResults: Victim visible at 19:47, 19:52. Shows frustrated body language. No clear view of interactions with other individuals.

evidence.name: Enhanced CCTV - Storage Area
evidence.description: Digitally enhanced footage from Camera 7 showing a figure carrying a wrench-like object near the storage area at approximately 20:10.
evidence.analysisResults: Image enhancement reveals blue-handled tool consistent with Tekiro wrench. Figure height and build matches several suspects.

evidence.name: Security Keycard Access Log
evidence.description: Digital log showing Rahman Pratama's keycard accessing storage room at 20:18, contradicting his stated alibi of being near information desk.
evidence.analysisResults: Timestamp: 20:18:34. Card ID: RS-001 (Rahman Pratama). Access granted to Storage Room B-7.

evidence.name: Electronic Schedule Display
evidence.description: Digital record of train schedule showing the 10-minute delay of the 19:45 Bekasi service, creating unusual passenger flow patterns.
evidence.analysisResults: Delay logged at 19:42. Caused by 'signal maintenance' - no maintenance was actually scheduled.

evidence.name: Security Budget Discrepancies
evidence.description: Financial documents showing irregularities in security improvement fund allocation, with several thousand dollars unaccounted for over the past six months.
evidence.analysisResults: Total discrepancy: Rp 45,000,000. Pak Budi's signature on all authorization forms. Pattern suggests systematic embezzlement.

evidence.name: Maya's Witness Statement
evidence.description: Written testimony from Maya Kusuma (ticket clerk) stating she saw Rahman talking to someone near the storage area around 20:15, contradicting his official statement.
evidence.analysisResults: Handwritten statement, signed and dated. Maya appeared nervous but consistent in her account. No obvious motive to lie.

evidence.name: Maintenance Department Tool Inventory
evidence.description: Official record of all tools issued to maintenance staff, including Tekiro wrench set issued to Agus Santoso in January 2024.
evidence.analysisResults: Tekiro 12-inch adjustable wrench, Serial #TK-2024-157, issued to Agus Santoso. Last inventory check: November 2024 - all tools accounted for.

evidence.name: Platform 2 Passenger Traffic Analysis
evidence.description: Automated passenger counting data showing dramatic 88% reduction in Platform 2 traffic between 19:45 and 20:15, correlating with the train delay and murder timeframe.
evidence.analysisResults: Statistically significant anomaly. Normal Platform 2 traffic: 40-70 passengers per 15-minute period. During incident: only 8 passengers.

evidence.name: Depot A Access History
evidence.description: Security logs showing who had access to Depot A where the murder weapon was hidden. Limited to authorized maintenance and security personnel.
evidence.analysisResults: Last 30 days: Agus Santoso (daily), Rahman Pratama (weekly security checks), Sari Indraswari (monthly inspections). No unauthorized access detected.

evidence.name: Pak Budi's Mobile Phone
evidence.description: Victim's smartphone found on his person, showing recent text messages and call logs that may reveal his state of mind and recent communications.
evidence.analysisResults: Last message sent at 20:12: 'Meet me at the usual place. We need to discuss your findings.' Sent to Rahman Pratama's number.
